========


Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.


Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the largest and most successful hybrid publisher in the world.


You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on midcore games.

**Role**
========


We’re looking for a senior Swiss army knife Artist who is a game maker at heart and who accepts the challenges of working in a fast-paced live game environment. You combine artistic excellence with product thinking and proactive ownership. We’re not looking for someone to wait to be given out tasks - you should take initiative and own it. You code whenever you can too.


Your outputs:

* Final assets that plug directly into Unity—implemented, not just designed
* Hypotheses and ideas that start from a player’s perspective and monetization lens, not just visual taste
* Proposals grounded in game direction, not generic moodboards
* Constant small improvements in live games: self-created Asana tasks, tagged team
* UI/UX designs challenged, improved, and implemented by you.

**Profile**
===========

* You don’t need to be explained what makes a great mobile game; 5+ years in mobile f2p, midcore preferred
* You don’t need an Art Director to nurture you: deliver assets that ship with zero or minimal rework
* You don’t need a developer to integrate your assets; 3+ years Unity experience, asset implementation & UI assembly
* You don’t need to be asked to use AI tools, because you already know them better than most (Uses AI tools across 2D, 3D, and video workflows)
* You don’t need an introduction to collaborative software (high proficiency in Figma)
* You don’t need to know what extra skills to get to be a killer Artist; you’re interested in animation and willing to grow in it
* You are easy to understand and you are a clear communicator in English (B2+)
* You get what sells and you are product-minded, proposing ideas grounded in game needs
* You are proactive by default
* You have felt game-making pain firsthand and you worked directly with a publisher or in a startup-like setting

**Nice to have:**

* Animation or VFX implementation
* C# fluency for Unity
* Has shipped multiple genres or styles)

**Benefits**
============

* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside
company_description: Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps.

title: Technical Writer
description:
Boule Diagnostics AB is a global diagnostics company that manufactures and markets instruments and consumable products for blood diagnostics. The company serves hospitals, clinics, laboratories and companies within blood diagnostics, in both human and veterinary hematology. The company operates via subsidiaries in Sweden, the USA, Mexico and Russia. The company products are sold globally primarily through distributors, supported by Boule’s own local sales and support personnel. The Boule shares are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2011.
We are seeking a detail-oriented and structured Technical Writer to join our Global Marketing team in Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for creating, editing, and maintaining high-quality documentation that supports our diagnostic products, that meets applicable standards and is appropriate for its intended audience. Your work will help ensure that healthcare professionals, technicians, service engineers, and internal stakeholders can effectively understand and use our solutions.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Produce and maintain:
	+ user manuals, installation guides, service manuals, and regulatory documentation for diagnostic instruments
	+ inserts and instructions for our reagents and consumables
	
	labels and other product related documents/markings  
	+
In collaboration with UX designers and developers, contribute to the preparation of intuitive and understandable interface text and guides.  
* 

Contribute to the preparation of training materials for laboratory staff and service engineers.  
* 

Manage documentation lifecycle from draft to release, including version control and updates. Maintain templates and modules of technical documents.  
* 

Analyze existing and potential content, focusing on reuse and single-sourcing opportunities.  
* 

Participate and/or drive Change Control activities related to technical documentation.  
* 

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to obtain an in-depth understanding of the product and the documentation needed.  
* 
* Ensure documentation complies with industry standards, regulatory requirements (e.g., IVDR, FDA), and internal quality systems.


**Qualifications**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Technical Communication, Life Sciences, Engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience as a technical writer, preferably in the diagnostics, medical device, or life sciences industry.
* Strong understanding of scientific and technical concepts, particularly in diagnostics or laboratory workflows.
* Experience with regulatory documentation (e.g., CE marking, FDA submissions).
* Proficiency with documentation tools such as Adobe InDesign and Teklynx Codesoft.
* Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and version control tools.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


Are you pragmatic and detail oriented? Do you work in a systematic, methodic, and well-structured manner? Do you enjoy simplifying complex ideas for a broader audience?



Join us as Technical writer!

title: Testare
description:
**Bli en nyckelspelare i resan mot världens bästa spelupplevelse**


Har du passion för test och älskar att automatisera? Vill du jobba med några av Sveriges mest välkända spelprodukter – som *Stryktipset*, *Europatipset*, *Spela tillsammans* och *Bomben*? Då är det kanske just dig vi letar efter.


Vi på Svenska Spel söker en Testare med erfarenhet av automatisering och utveckling till vårt agila team IT-sport – en grupp engagerade kollegor som drivs av ny teknik, innovation och laganda.

 **Vad kommer du att göra?**


I rollen testar du både nya funktioner och förändringar av befintliga. Du arbetar tight med frontendutvecklare, UX/designers och produktägare i en techorganisation som andas nyfikenhet och mod att testa nya saker. Det finns goda möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll. Allt är upp till dig!


Du kommer att utforma och genomföra testfall för både manuell och automatiserad testning för att säkerställa att våra produkter uppfyller krav på både kvalitet och tillgänglighet, samt att dokumentera och rapportera eventuella buggar och avvikelser. Du samarbetar också tvärfunktionellt med andra team i organisationen.


Dina ansvarsområden kommer att inkludera testplanering, testdesign, testautomatisering, regressionstestning och användbarhetstestning. Du kommer även att samarbeta med andra teammedlemmar för att säkerställa en kontinuerlig förbättring av våra testprocesser och verktyg.

 **Är du den som kommer att göra det?**


Vi söker dig som är en erfaren och engagerad testare, där ditt huvudansvar kommer att vara att kvalitetssäkra teamets leveranser. Som person är du noggrann, strukturerad och har en stark analytisk förmåga. Du trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team och har en stark vilja att leverera högkvalitativa resultat. Du har gedigen kunskap inom testmetodik, testverktyg och testautomatisering.


Du har en hög analys- och problemlösningsförmåga. Du lär dig gärna och snabbt och har en fallenhet för att själv driva och avsluta det du påbörjar. Du trivs med struktur såväl i ditt eget arbete som för teamets processer.


Du känner också igen dig i följande erfarenheter och kompetenser

* + Akademisk utbildning inom systemvetenskap/IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet
	+ Erfarenhet av att implementera automatiserade tester i frontend
	+ Genomföra och testa tillgänglighetsanpassningar
	+ Erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna Javascript-ramverk som t.ex. React eller Typescript
	+ Erfarenhet av att arbeta med testramverk, t.ex. Playwright eller Cypress
	+ Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Det är också meriterande om du har erfarenhet av transaktionsintensiva system med krav på hög tillgänglighet samt att genomföra tester i GCP (Google Cloud Platform) eller andra Cloudlösningar.  

  



Vi värdesätter din förmåga att arbeta i en agil miljö och din förmåga att kommunicera effektivt med olika intressenter.  

  

**Om Tech på Svenska Spel**


På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Det här kommer med ett ansvar, både för folkets drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Vi flyttar ständigt fram gränserna för vår tech och låter aldrig vår Drömmaskin stå still. Kom och utveckla den med oss!

**Vi är Svenska Spel**


Svenska Spel är hela Sveriges spelbolag. Vi skapar hållbara och roliga spelupplevelser som bidrar till ett bättre Sverige. Genom spel som Triss, Stryktipset och Oddset ger vi våra fyra miljoner kunder spänning, glädje och drömmar. Våra spel är enkla och trygga och oavsett om man spelar online eller fysiskt, själv eller tillsammans med andra, så ska upplevelsen alltid vara positiv. Vi vill att fler ska spela hållbart hos oss och vår verksamhet ska bedrivas på ett socialt, ekonomiskt och miljömässigt ansvarsfullt sätt. Varje år går överskottet till statskassan. Vi är Sveriges största idrottssponsor och investerar nära 300 miljoner kronor årligen i svensk idrott. Vi är modiga, nyfikna och strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör samt skapar resultat tillsammans.

*Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem* *här**!*




**A****nsökan och kontaktuppgifter**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Stockholm med möjlighet till flexibelt distansarbete.

  

För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Johanna Lange, Chef IT Sport, johanna.lange@svenskaspel.se


För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se  

  

#LI-HYBRID
company_description: På Svenska Spel gör vi jobbet där det passar bäst. Det kan antingen vara på något av våra kontor i Solna, Visby eller Göteborg. Eller någon annanstans. Där du mår bäst presterar du bäst, helt enkelt.

title: Junior UX/UI Coordinator
description:
*Gillar du att skapa användarupplevelser i världsklass - att nyfiket utforska och analysera användarbeteenden, samt att göra komplexa lösningar enkla? Är du en fena på att tyda trender och omvandla insikter till rekommendationer? Ligger UX-design dig därtill varmt om hjärtat, samtidigt som du har ett öga för visuell design och har koll på UI-hantverket? Då vill vi veta mer om dig!*


Vi förstärker nu vårt fantastiska **produktteam** med en **Junior UX/UI Coordinator**. Som vår nästa kollega kommer du att vara del av ett **UX-drivet team** som har en central roll på BookBeat. Du kommer att jobba nära vår produktdesigner, olika produktägare och våra utvecklare i ett team där vi värdesätter tight **samarbete** högt för att hålla processen från idé till verklighet snabb och smidig. Vi bollar och diskuterar idéer på daglig basis för att **tillsammans** **förbättra användarupplevelsen** i vår app och våra interna system.

  

Din roll kommer att vara en viktig del i teamet för att fortsatt driva vårt användarcentrerade arbete. Det innebär bland annat att **identifiera trender, skapa prototyper och genomföra tester –** **insiktsdrivet arbete** som hjälper oss att förstå vår omvärld samt våra användares drivkrafter ännu mer, och som ligger till grund för vår produktutveckling. I rollen ingår också **administrativa och koordinerande uppgifter**, till exempel att sammanställa och dela insikter med teamet, dokumentera lärdomar samt hålla ihop vissa moment i produktutvecklingsprocessen. Har du dessutom kunskaper inom och passion för **användarcentrerad UI-design** är det ett stort plus!

**Nyutexaminerad** (och spänd på att få tillämpa dina nyförvärvade kunskaper) **eller med något års arbetslivserfarenhet** spelar mindre roll för oss – **rätt kompetens, driv och personlighet är nyckeln till att utvecklas i denna roll.** För att lyckas i rollen som Junior UX/UI Coordinator ser vi att du är en **driven,** **nyfiken och självgående person** som gärna tar egna initiativ, samtidigt som du **uppskattar teamarbete** och när andra kommer med idéer. Du sporras av tanken att få bidra till vår fortsatta produktutveckling och att få vässa användarupplevelsen av BookBeat tillsammans med produktteamet.

**I rollen ingår bland annat att:**

* Skapa en förståelse för våra användares behov och drivkrafter, genom att titta på användardata, följa och analysera användarbeteenden.
* Med användaren i fokus vara med och trimma våra flöden, både övergripande och i detalj.
* Skissa samt skapa prototyper för appen och våra interna system tillsammans med teamet.
* Bevaka trender och konkurrenter.
* Planera, genomföra och analysera användarintervjuer, tester och workshops.
* Koordinera och administrera vissa projekt och aktiviteter.
* Skriva användarvänlig och tydlig copy.
* Kontinuerligt dela insikter om användarnas beteenden med teamet.

**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är kommunikativ, strukturerad och trivs med att hålla workshops och intervjuer.
* Har kunskap och intresse för UI-design och är bekväm med skissning och prototypframtagning.
* Behärskar och förstår olika research-metoder samt när och hur de ska genomföras i en produktutvecklingsprocess.
* Är nyfiken på trender och omvärld inom UX och design.
* Kan bearbeta och ge rekommendationer utifrån dataanalyser, undersökningar och best practice.
* Är bekväm med att skriva copy på svenska och engelska.
* Trivs i agila team och gillar gemensamma utmaningar.
* Har en relevant utbildning inom området eller jämförbar praktisk erfarenhet.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i både tal och skrift.

Låter detta som en spännande roll för dig? Toppen! Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Har du frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta vår Product Manager App, Aida Lagumdzija, på aida.lagumdzija@bookbeat.com.

**Som anställd på BookBeat AB erbjuds du ett förmånspaket som inkluderar:**


30 dagar semester per år  

ITP1-tjänstepension  

TGL (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring), TFA (trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada) & tjänstereseförsäkring  

Årligt friskvårdsbidrag  

‍️ Veckovis friskvårdstimme  

Arbetsutrustning (dator och telefon) samt abonnemang  

BookBeat prenumeration


**Utöver våra förmåner erbjuder vi dig också:**


En stabil och hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi använder flextid och jobbar 37,9 timmar per vecka  

Ett kontor i centrala Stockholm  

‍️ … inklusive tillgång till ett fullt utrustat gym med bastu! Vi arrangerar också ett gäng roliga aktiviteter med koppling till hälsa och välmående, såsom vår egna springklubb  

Flexibilitet i form av flexibla arbetstimmar och vår hybrid-policy när det kommer till arbete från kontoret/hemmet  

Möjligheten att växa i din roll och karriär, inklusive utmanande och lärorika arbetsuppgifter samt andra möjligheter till utveckling  

Roliga aktiviteter tillsammans med dina kollegor! På BookBeat får du ta del av veckovisa "Friday afternoon mingles", månatliga företagsfrukostar och andra härliga arbetsrelaterade aktiviteter regelbundet tillsammans med hela företaget  

Möjligheten att utforska projekt du inte har tid för i ditt dagliga arbete under våra Hack Days  

Kunskapsdelningsmöjligheter, exempelvis under våra veckovisa "Friday demos" tillsammans med hela företaget där olika team delar vad de har jobbat på, jobbar på eller kommer jobba på. Kunskapsdelning är också en viktig del av vårt dagliga arbete!  

Möjligheten att ta med din fyrbenta hundvän till jobbet (och att gosa med hundar på kontoret)! Vi har nyligen introducerat ett hundrum på vårt Stockholmskontor  

(Sist men inte minst) ett härligt och kompetent team och chef som kommer stötta dig genom din anställning!

**Om oss**  

År 2015 påbörjade vi vår resa mot målet att erbjuda Europas ledande tjänst för digitala böcker, och 2016 lanserade vi till allmänheten. Nu, snart 9 år efter vår breda lansering, används BookBeat av över 1 miljon användare varje månad. Vi är ett ständigt växande företag inom Bonnierkoncernen och alla medlemmar som är del av vår resa har möjlighet att påverka vår utveckling – både på kort och lång sikt.  

  

Idag består Team BookBeat av runt 170 nyfikna och engagerade "doers". Är du intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team? Underbart! Våra anställda är experter på många olika områden, men vi har fyra kärnvärderingar som enar oss alla:

  

Var fantastisk på det du gör  

Dela det du vet och kan  

Nyfikenhet för våra användare och oss  

Bygg Team BookBeat



Med andra ord: vi vill att våra medarbetare kontinuerligt ska djupdyka i och utvecklas inom sina kompetensområden, men också att de delar den kunskapen med sina kollegor – vi är alla del av Team BookBeat och samarbetar (oftast mycket) dagligen! Vi söker också medarbetare som är genuint nyfikna på våra användare samt på vår resa och organisation, en nyfikenhet som driver oss till att alltid testa nya saker i vår tjänst och att låta våra användare visa oss om vi är på rätt väg. Sist men definitivt inte minst vill vi att våra anställda ska bidra till Team BookBeats vardagliga samarbete och välmående – som redan nämnt är vi alla del av ett större team, ett team som vi vill ska må bra och ha kul på jobbet, något vi alla bidrar till på olika sätt.

title: User researcher
description:
***Are you passionate about games, research, and how to best combine the two? Then come join the User Research team at Paradox Interactive and help us make our games better!***
 Paradox’s User Research team does user experience research for all our games, both developed and published by Paradox. As a User Researcher, you will be responsible for conducting a variety of research activities.
   

  

 Your research will support the decision-making of our game developers. Your work will be critical in helping us understand the needs and behaviours of our users.
   

  

 You will also get to take an active role in developing our methodology, testing environment, and help us build one of the best User Research teams in the industry. Our current UR team consists of eight people.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Own and deliver the operational execution of our user research projects
* Coordinate with other researchers, designers, producers and developers to address research related issues
* Identify and prioritize the research methodologies that will best support the game team's goals
* Translate findings into actionable insights and communicate these to game teams and other stakeholders at Paradox Interactive


**What We Are Looking For**
* Experience with user research, service design, experimental psychology, cognitive psychology, human-computer interaction, or equivalent
* Having worked with a wide range of qualitative research methods such as — such as playtesting, interviews, surveys, focus groups, diary studies etc.
* Comfortable coordinating clients, other researchers, and participants simultaneously when conducting research
* Experience in Quantitative Research
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills (English)
* 2-3 years relevant experience in games industry
* Strong personal interest in gaming and market trends


 On a personal level you’re passionate about helping others succeed. You find communication with people of different professions (game design, production, marketing) inspiring and you have a strong sense of self-leadership. You enjoy the balancing act between conducting sound research and delivering objective, actionable results with tight time-frames, and don’t mind challenging established views.
   

  

 You’ll work alongside designers, developers, and fellow researchers to ensure games are fun, intuitive, and engaging—because we believe the best games are made when players are part of the process.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: User Research manager
   

  

 Location: This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

*If you think that this description matches your background, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously for this position. In your application, please show us why your previous experiences and skills would work for this role and why you are interested in working at Paradox. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in Paradox might compensate for this.*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Product Designer H&M Womens – Regional Assortment
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are looking for an experienced Senior Designer to join our Regional Assortment department with a focus on our Indian region. This position will be based in our Head office in Stockholm but will require some travel to India.
   

  

 As a Designer for Regional Relevance, you will focus on creating collections for our different regions that require special attention to tailor our collections to suit the relevant target customer. As a Product Designer you will work closely with our teams in both Stockholm and India to achieve this. You will set extended visual goals based on our main collection and will plan the assortment on a concept level together with the Regional Relevance Manager and Design Lead. You will be working with a wide assortment along with key fashion drops and local campaigns.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 As a Senior Designer you will work alongside our Lead Designer and will be part of a wider team of Designers, Product Developers, Planners, Pattern Makers, and a Product Manager.
   

  

 We are looking for Designers who love to collaborate, work in a team, and provide our diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion level with commercial awareness! It will be key also to keep a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while maintaining a cost-conscious awareness throughout the design process.
   

  

 This is an amazing opportunity to collaborate with our fashion conscious, forward thinking global team. There will also be opportunities to travel to South Asia along the way.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Designer with....
   

  

* A minimum of a BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion/Textile Design.
* 3+ years’ work experience as a Designer.
* Background from an aspirational global brand or retailer.
* International experience would be advantageous.
* High attention to detail with strong knowledge on Womenswear products.
* A creative mindset with a sharp eye for both current and future trends.
* Strong customer focus and commercial mindset for H&M´s global womenswear customer.
* Experience working closely with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe.
* Strong skills in and used to working in Adobe Creative Suite programs.
* 3D CLO is advantageous.
* Demonstrated communication skills and a true collaborative team player.
* Independent, driven & proactive with “one step ahead” mindset.
* Organized & structured, able to set priorities and follow timelines.
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast-moving & growing industry.
* Experience or a desire to coach Junior Designers would be beneficial.
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary).


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position is based in Stockholm. You will report to the department Assortment Designer
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work (pdf max 10mb/uploading). All documents should be in English.
   

  

 For internal candidates: please remember to always speak with your current manager when applying for an internal role. Please know that if you are currently permanently employed, you will keep this base employment status while taking on a temporary role.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


 The journey starts here

title: Yuppie söker en Design Intern
description:
**📍 Stockholm (eller remote inom Sverige)** 




  





**Är du en nyfiken, driven och kreativ designer som älskar branding och vill testa dina vingar på riktigt? Då vill vi höra från dig.** 




  





**Som intern hos oss på Yuppie blir du en del av vårt ambitiösa team och får jobba med riktiga projekt för riktiga varumärken. Du är med från idé till leverans och får bidra med allt från visuella koncept till detaljerad produktion. Ditt arbete kommer att inkludera design för webb, sociala medier, kampanjer, trycksaker och presentationer.** 




  




**Vi söker dig som:** 
* **Studerar design (eller nyligen avslutat studier)**
* **Har koll på Figma och Adobe Suite**
* **Är bekväm i team men gillar att ta egna initiativ**
* **Har känsla för typografi och detaljer**
* **Brinner för varumärken och kreativa idéer**
* **Talar och skriver flytande svenska**
* **Bor i Sverige**



  





**Bonus om du är nyfiken på rörlig grafik, digitala plattformar eller ny teknik – men viktigast är att du vill utvecklas och göra riktigt bra grejer.** 




  




**Vi erbjuder:** 
* **En praktikperiod på ca 8–20 veckor**
* **Möjlighet att jobba remote**
* **En kul miljö där idéer får ta plats**
* **Ett tight team med högt i tak**



  





**------** 




  





**🗓 Vi intervjuar löpande under hösten**

title: Senior Game Producer
description:
**Job Description**
 The Quickspin Producer leads our game development projects, from the vision to the execution of roadmaps. You lead a cross functional team daily, while staying within the boundaries of budget, time, and resource plans.
   

  

 You take the game from internal concept ideas to going live with our vast selection of operator customers. You are the link between product, development, and sales to assure the game’s success at all stages.
   

  

 This role suits you who likes to combine structure and creativity. You will be an integral part of the Product team within Quickspin, doing both project & product management, and will play an important part in the creation of world’s most awesome video slots.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required Skills and Qualifications:**
* Excellent understanding in what makes game fun and exciting.
* 5+ years of experience in a similar role within the iGaming industry, specifically focused on the production of slot games.
* Strong experience in Jira, Photoshop, PowerPoint, and game design tools.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Proven experience in pitching ideas to stakeholders effectively.
* Strong team leadership skills.


**Additional Preferred Experience**
* Experience in live gaming production and a deep understanding of the gaming industry.
* Strong analytical skills for game design and player engagement.
* Familiarity with Figma is a plus.
* Programming knowledge in any language.


**Main Responsibilities**
* Pitching ideas to stakeholders with clarity and enthusiasm.
* Leading and inspiring the game team through the development process.
* Overseeing game design to ensure creative and technical alignment.
* Managing projects efficiently, ensuring timelines are met.
* Collaborating closely with marketing and commercial teams to ensure game success.
* Representing Quickspin at industry events and conferences.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Who You Are And What We Offer**
 You are a team player with strong initiative and self-motivation thriving in a team environment where the route from idea to implementation is very short. In return we offer an excellent benefit package and a challenging and rewarding job in one of the fastest growing and most exciting industries there is.
   

  

 You will work in a creative, and fun atmosphere at an award-winning company. We are also proud to say that you’ll have the opportunity to have your work seen and enjoyed by millions of users, world-wide.

title: Product Manager - Unified UX team
description:
***Product Manager - Unified UX team***




  





 Applications are considered on a rolling basis
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Oslo
 



  





**Join Our Team as a Product Manager at Simployer!** 




 We're seeking an experienced Product Manager to join our Unified Suite team. This team focuses on the infrastructure and experiences that connect our product modules, enabling a seamless, user-centric ecosystem. Your role is to bridge the gap between technical realities and strategic ambitions, helping users experience the system as a cohesive, integrated whole. You’ll work across product teams to develop the foundational infrastructure that supports cross-product functionality and consistent design patterns. AI will be an important enabler in this work. You'll collaborate closely with a talented group of backend and frontend engineers, as well as strong UX experts in design systems and accessibility. You'll also be part of a broader product community, working with PMs driving the full product forward.
 



  





**Team mission and ownership** 




 The mission is to help users seamlessly navigate the product suite, stay on top of tasks and notifications, and experience the system as a cohesive, integrated whole. The team owns the following components:
 


* **Dashboard and Global Menu:** 
 The central hub providing users with an overview of their work and access to all modules.
* **Action Hub/Notifications:** 
 The system keeping users informed of updates and tasks across all products.
* **Design Systems and Component Library:** 
 Shared UI building blocks ensuring consistency across the product suite.
* **Translations:** 
 Infrastructure enabling multilingual support throughout the platform.



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**What you will do** 



* Create and maintain a roadmap that balances immediate needs with long-term strategic goals.
* Coordinate work across teams, aligning on shared components, navigation patterns, and notification systems.
* Build trusted relationships with product teams, engineering leaders, and designers, driving consensus across diverse priorities.
* Plan and execute phased rollouts of cross-product changes, ensuring proper documentation and support for other teams.
* Define and track success metrics for adoption and effectiveness, using feedback to continuously improve the unified experience.



  





**What you bring to the team** 



* **Growth Mindset:** 
 Thrives in dynamic environments, embracing ambiguity as a space for innovation and growth. You have an AI-first mindset, continuously exploring how emerging technologies can enhance product capabilities and improve team efficiency.
* **Strategic Vision:** 
 Comfortable balancing short-term delivery needs with long-term product vision, with a clear outcome-based mindset.
* **Technical Literacy:** 
 Comfortable engaging with technical details. Understanding frontend technologies, component libraries, and system architecture is a plus.
* **Cross-Product Experience:** 
 Proven experience developing unified product experiences, shared components, or integrated systems.
* **Cross-Team Leadership:** 
 Skilled at building relationships and resolving issues, with the ability to coordinate projects across multiple teams and drive consensus.
* **Prioritization & Decision Making:** 
 Experienced in making tough trade-off decisions with competing priorities.



  





**Hello from Hiring Manger** 




*Hello, I’m Jonatan Lindqvist, Head of Product at Simployer. With over 15 years in the product world, my passion for building meaningful and impactful products is as strong as ever. I’m excited about how AI can unlock new value and deeply committed to creating products that truly make a difference in people’s lives. I also believe that empowered, purpose-driven teams are the engine of exceptional results. At Simployer, our mission to unleash the full potential in people aligns perfectly with this philosophy, making it an inspiring place to lead and innovate. If this resonates with you, I look forward to meeting you!* 




  





**Ready for Your Next Challenge?** 




 If you're excited to take on new challenges, launch great products, and join a company that values teamwork and excellence, we'd love to hear from you! Don’t wait—reach out to us as soon as possible!
 



  





 You can reach out to our Talent Partner Niklas (niklas.jonsson@simployer.com)
 



  





**Our Hiring Process:** 



1. **Meet our Talent Partner -** 
 Screening interview to cover the basics and intro to role and Simployer
2. **Meet & Greet with hiring manager** 
 – A friendly introduction to get to know each other.
3. **Personality Test** 
 (Alva Labs) – Discover how you’ll fit with our team.
4. **Case Interview** 
 – Show us your skills through real-world problem-solving.
5. **HR Interview** 
 – Let’s talk culture, values, and your future with us.



  





**We can’t wait to meet you!** 




 At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Duyen Nguyen
 



 duyen.nguyen@simployer.com

title: Senior Product Manager
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 




  






 Yubico is looking for a Senior Product Manager to expand and maintain products within the Hardware products. You will drive and deliver the success of your products/product areas of focus and expand the use of our technology to new and innovative areas that capture the market demand. Be part of a fast-paced, high-energy team, working with customers that represent some of the most sophisticated technology buyers on the planet.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Responsible for the production systems that are used to program, customize, and output YubiKey's and YubiHSM's at scale
* Provide data-driven insights on the specific products being managed, including sales and financial performance, year-over-year trends, pipeline, etc
* Manage the full life-cycle of a product from inception to end of life including: conception, market and requirements gathering, customer validation, creation of high-quality requirements document, management of engineering, marketing preparation, release and end-of-life processes
* Meet with customers to understand market demand and outcomes for new products
* Partner with all teams in the company, demonstrating ownership for the product area of focus, to develop and launch new products that meet company objectives and achieve a successful product
* Take responsibility for the success of all aspects of the products, or product areas, in focus
* Gain deep market and technical knowledge of the market focused on specific competitors and their offerings and strategies
* Understand the core value of both the products being managed, but also all products and services at Yubico
* Articulate the core value of the product and inspire other team members to be excited about selling and supporting the products
* Maintain the ability to have deep technical conversations about Yubico technology, but also the underlying technology platforms, etc
* Collaborate with product marketing to create or enhance product collateral, marketing messaging, blogs, and related activities
* Represent Yubico in meetings with key customers and partners to help drive our business



  




**Basic Requirements:** 
* Five (5) years’ experience in Product Management
* One or more of the following: Eight (8) years’ experience in IT or technology, Eight (8) years’ experience in security
* Experience in managing stakeholders
* Excellent written and oral business communication skills
* Ability to collaborate across geographically dispersed functions






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Chief Technology Officer
company_industry: Travel Arrangements, Information Services, and Software Development
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Chief Technology Officer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (2-3 days per week hybrid)
 



  





**Job Overview**




  





 We are supporting a fast-growing SaaS company in the travel space, building scalable, user-centric solutions that simplify bookings and automate operations. They're looking for a hands-on CTO to lead our technology vision and execution. You’ll own the tech strategy and roadmap, lead the engineering team, and ensure the scalability and reliability of our platform (web & mobile). This is both a strategic and roll-up-your-sleeves role, ideal for someone excited to build and scale a product that matters.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:**




  




* Set and execute the technical vision, aligning with business goals.
* Lead platform development, architecture, and integrations.
* Build and mentor a high-performing engineering team.
* Drive innovation in automation, scalability, and user experience.
* Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Operations on feature priorities.
* Ensure compliance, security, and performance best practices.
* Stay current on travel tech trends, APIs, and standards (e.g., NDC).



  





**Qualifications:**




  




* Previous experience as CTO or senior engineering leader in SaaS.
* Strong technical background in modern web stacks
* Experience with SaaS platforms, cloud infrastructure, and CI/CD.
* Bonus: familiarity with travel industry standards and systems.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.



  





**How to Apply:** 




  





 Should you find this opportunity compelling and believe your qualifications align with the position, we invite you to kindly forward your resume. Alternatively, you may choose to establish contact with me through LinkedIn or by email at amber.jones@select-tech.co.uk

title: Technical Writer
description:
*Boule Diagnostics AB is a global diagnostics company that manufactures and markets instruments and consumable products for blood diagnostics. The company serves hospitals, clinics, laboratories and companies within blood diagnostics, in both human and veterinary hematology. The company operates via subsidiaries in Sweden, the USA, Mexico and Russia. The company products are sold globally primarily through distributors, supported by Boule’s own local sales and support personnel. The Boule shares are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2011.*
 We are seeking a detail-oriented and structured Technical Writer to join our Global Marketing team in Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for creating, editing, and maintaining high-quality documentation that supports our diagnostic products, that meets applicable standards and is appropriate for its intended audience. Your work will help ensure that healthcare professionals, technicians, service engineers, and internal stakeholders can effectively understand and use our solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
  

  

* Produce and maintain:
+ user manuals, installation guides, service manuals, and regulatory documentation for diagnostic instruments
+ inserts and instructions for our reagents and consumables
+ labels and other product related documents/markings

* In collaboration with UX designers and developers, contribute to the preparation of intuitive and understandable interface text and guides.
* Contribute to the preparation of training materials for laboratory staff and service engineers.
* Manage documentation lifecycle from draft to release, including version control and updates. Maintain templates and modules of technical documents.
* Analyze existing and potential content, focusing on reuse and single-sourcing opportunities.
* Participate and/or drive Change Control activities related to technical documentation.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to obtain an in-depth understanding of the product and the documentation needed.
* Ensure documentation complies with industry standards, regulatory requirements (e.g., IVDR, FDA), and internal quality systems.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Technical Communication, Life Sciences, Engineering, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience as a technical writer, preferably in the diagnostics, medical device, or life sciences industry.
* Strong understanding of scientific and technical concepts, particularly in diagnostics or laboratory workflows.
* Experience with regulatory documentation (e.g., CE marking, FDA submissions).
* Proficiency with documentation tools such as Adobe InDesign and Teklynx Codesoft.
* Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and version control tools.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


 Are you pragmatic and detail oriented? Do you work in a systematic, methodic, and well-structured manner? Do you enjoy simplifying complex ideas for a broader audience?
   

  

 Join us as Technical writer!

title: Product Owner for Entitlements
job_function: Project Management, Business Development, and Information Technology
description:
