title: Game Designer - Crusader Kings
description:
**Your Mission**
 As a
 **Game Designer** 
 on the Crusader Kings III team in Stockholm, you will be working towards the vision set by the Game Director, finding the solutions for game systems and in-game content that live up to the expectations of our players. You will achieve this by collaborating with other developers and with an ability to convey design through excellent communication and teamwork. You will also work with implementing your solutions in the game engine making sure it is balanced and working as intended.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Designing and implementing gameplay systems using our in-house scripting language in coordination with other game designers
* Writing and Scripting short narratives, and adding other types of content to the gameplay systems
* Understanding our players and finding the fun to add player value


**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Game Designer on a game team (or similar modding experience)
* Experience with writing text for in-game content in (American) English
* Proficiency with scripting for game content
* Deep and genuine interest in strategy games. You have played the Crusader Kings franchise extensively.


**Work Culture**
 We are dedicated to crafting thought-provoking games that our players adore and are eager to enjoy endlessly. Every member of the Paradox team is committed to contributing their best and sharing the drive to achieve our goals, reaching new pinnacles as a united force. Creativity, autonomy, and self-initiation are the building blocks of our game development process, all made feasible by a substantial foundation of trust. We are establishing this trust-based environment by having faith in our colleagues to act with the best of intentions.
   

  

 Our culture evolves through our engagements with our players and our deep understanding of their desires and expectations. We're dedicated to comprehending our players and what they truly cherish in our games, as well as their mindset while enjoying them.
   

  

**Practical information**
 Scope: Full time and permanent
   

  

 Reports to: Design Manager
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 Work is full time on-site with flexibility.
   

  

 We will not relocate for this position.
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Integration Platform Owner
description:
*Are you someone who genuinely cares about making integrations easier, faster, and more sustainable across teams? Do you want to work with something that’s still forming, where your decisions will shape how things are done for years to come? Then keep reading.*
 We’re in the early phase of introducing a new integration platform at GlobalConnect – defining how it works, how it will be used, and how it fits into our IT landscape. That’s where this role comes in.
   

  

 As Integration Platform Owner, you’ll take responsibility for the platform as a product. Your job is to make sure it’s reliable, understandable, and something developers across our Nordic teams want to use. The goal is simple: make integrations easier and more consistent so teams can connect systems without starting from scratch.
   

  

 You’ll work with architects, developers, and colleagues across IT to define technical guidelines, establish governance, support onboarding, and ensure the platform is useful in practice.
   

  

 This is a great moment to join. The platform is new, and the way of working is still being shaped. What you build now will influence how integrations are handled at GlobalConnect for years.
   

  

**The role and why it matters**
**You’ll Be The Integration Platform Owner. That Means**
* You will be accountable for the Platform including the technical design and implementation, how the platform is used, including standards and usage patterns and governance – in particular to influence and drive adoption.
* You will also be responsible for related platform admin, security, compliance, lifecycle management, and related costs.
* This isn’t a technical architect or developer role. It’s about platform adoption, governance, and usability. Your job is to make the platform work across GlobalConnect in practice, not just in theory.
* You’ll work with development teams across different stacks, alongside architects and specialists, to align on shared ways of working and build trust in the platform.
* You’ll help us understand how the platform is being used and where it can be improved to better support the business.


**What The Work Includes**
* Own the Frends integration platform and API gateway
* Ensure the platform is production-ready during the implementation phase
* Lead governance by establishing collaborative ways of working, aligning teams, and defining shared standards
* Create and maintain documentation on APIs, logging, security, and naming
* Support developer onboarding so teams can adopt the platform in their existing workflows
* Build trust with developers by showing how the platform fits into their day-to-day work
* Monitor usage and adoption to understand what’s working and where to improve


**What We Think You’ve Worked With Before**
* Experience working with an integration platform such as Frends, MuleSoft, WebMethods, or Azure Integration Services
* Previous responsibility as a system owner or similar role, ideally where governance and adoption were key parts of the work
* Experience working closely with developers, architects, and other IT colleagues
* Comfortable in an agile, evolving setup where ways of working are still being shaped
* Experience from the telecom domain and familiarity with industry frameworks such as TM Forum (TMF) or MEF standards is a plus


**Who You Are**
 You enjoy working across teams, are curious about how things work, and like finding better ways to solve problems.
   

  

* You’re used to influencing others, not just directing them
* You communicate clearly and adjust your approach depending on the audience
* You bring structure but are flexible when things change
* You understand the value of consistency and when it makes sense to deviate from it


 You’ll be part of a small integration function within Group IT, based in Stockholm or Copenhagen. We work across systems, teams, and countries with a clear goal: make integration easier and more consistent across GlobalConnect.
   

  

*You don’t need to submit a personal letter unless there’s something about your background you want to explain that isn’t clear from your CV or LinkedIn profile.* 
 We look forward to hearing from you.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: Lead Game Designer - Block Jam 3D
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±3h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of casual, hybrid-casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Block Jam 3D** 
**.**
 With Block Jam 3D, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a Lead Game Designer to join the Block Jam 3D team and help push our game to the next level in meta design, gameplay features, and player engagement.
   

  

 The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with top-grossing Match-3 or puzzle mobile games and a strong understanding of mechanics, systems, and hybrid F2P economies that make these games successful. You will work closely with Product, Art, and Engineering to create engaging features, refined gameplay loops, and innovative meta-systems that improve player retention, monetization, and overall fun.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Feature & System Design
+ Design new gameplay features, core loops, and meta systems to drive long-term engagement and monetization.
+ Create detailed design documents, user flows, and economy models.
+ Propose AB test ideas and iterate based on player data and feedback.

* Puzzle & Gameplay Tuning
+ Work with level designers to enhance puzzle mechanics and moment-to-moment gameplay.
+ Ensure the gameplay experience is satisfying, accessible, and monetization-friendly.

* Collaboration & Execution
+ Partner with product managers and engineers to deliver features from concept to live release.
+ Collaborate with artists to ensure UX and visuals support the intended player experience.

* Player-Centric Development
+ Analyze player behavior and KPIs to inform design decisions.
+ Proactively identify opportunities to improve retention, engagement, and IAP monetization..


 Profile
   

  

* 5+ years of professional game design experience in mobile free-to-play games.
* At least one shipped Match-3 or top puzzle mobile title with proven success.
* Strong knowledge of:
+ F2P mechanics and hybrid monetization strategies.
+ Meta systems, live ops, and long-term engagement loops.
+ Economy balancing and feature progression.

* Proficient in clear and comprehensive design documentation.
* Comfortable with data-driven decision-making and AB testing.
* Collaborative mindset with excellent communication skills.


**Nice to have**
* Experience in Puzzle games, Match 3 puzzle, Sort games…
* A degree in game design, computer science, or a related field would be beneficial.


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Senior Producer - Games
description:
Embark is hiring a Producer to join THE FINALS, our critically-acclaimed innovative online shooter. As a member of the production team, you will partner with creative stakeholders to help multiple teams deliver on their goals. You have a drive for removing obstacles, solving problems, and making sure things get done. You know that helping a team work better is a mix of high-minded organizational principles and practical compromises. And you must play games, understand games, and have a deep interest in games as an entertainment medium.
   

  

 At Embark, we believe in building teams of game makers - people who have ownership over the piece of the game they’re creating. As a Producer here, you are a safe pair of hands and the safety net below the creative and technical people who are the very best in the industry at what they do.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Be a servant leader for multiple cross-functional teams, helping them continuously improve and iterate on the game making process
* Foresee potential roadblocks in the future, proactively addressing them or bringing the right people together to address them
* Generally problem-solve with your teams to maximize the benefit to player experience within our constraints
* Manage the development process for your teams, nurturing sustainable day-to-day, sprint-to-sprint, and milestone-to-milestone rhythms of productio
* Communicate and overcommunicate with your teams, stakeholders, and external teams - horizontally, vertically, and around corners


**We would love if you have**
* 5 years of experience as a producer or team lead in the PC/console space
* Experience with live service titles and their development cadence
* Experience with the benefits and drawbacks of working with cross-functional teams
* Excellent communication skills that allow you to explain complex ideas and motivate teams through mutual understanding
* A proactive, humble, and conscientious attitude, with a high sense of ownership and autonomy
* An organized and detail-oriented mindset, the ability to thrive within ambiguity and messiness, and the patience to bring the former to tame the latter
* A lifetime of experience playing videogames and a longtime fascination with the craft of making them


*For this role we are only considering candidates already residing in Sweden.*
 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior Game Designer - Block Jam 3D
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±3h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of casual, hybrid-casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Block Jam 3D** 
**.**
 With Block Jam 3D, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Game Designer to join the Block Jam 3D team and help push our game to the next level in meta design, gameplay features, and player engagement.
   

  

 The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with top-grossing Match-3 or puzzle mobile games and a strong understanding of mechanics, systems, and hybrid F2P economies that make these games successful. You will work closely with Product, Art, and Engineering to create engaging features, refined gameplay loops, and innovative meta-systems that improve player retention, monetization, and overall fun.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Feature & System Design
+ Design new gameplay features, core loops, and meta systems to drive long-term engagement and monetization.
+ Create detailed design documents, user flows, and economy models.
+ Propose AB test ideas and iterate based on player data and feedback.

* Puzzle & Gameplay Tuning
+ Work with level designers to enhance puzzle mechanics and moment-to-moment gameplay.
+ Ensure the gameplay experience is satisfying, accessible, and monetization-friendly.

* Collaboration & Execution
+ Partner with product managers and engineers to deliver features from concept to live release.
+ Collaborate with artists to ensure UX and visuals support the intended player experience.

* Player-Centric Development
+ Analyze player behavior and KPIs to inform design decisions.
+ Proactively identify opportunities to improve retention, engagement, and IAP monetization..


 Profile
   

  

* 3+ years of professional game design experience in mobile free-to-play games.
* At least one shipped Match-3 or top puzzle mobile title with proven success.
* Strong knowledge of:
+ F2P mechanics and hybrid monetization strategies.
+ Meta systems, live ops, and long-term engagement loops.
+ Economy balancing and feature progression.

* Proficient in clear and comprehensive design documentation.
* Comfortable with data-driven decision-making and AB testing.
* Collaborative mindset with excellent communication skills.


**Nice to have**
* Experience in Puzzle games, Match 3 puzzle, Sort games…
* A degree in game design, computer science, or a related field would be beneficial.


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Technical Artist - Mob Control
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position is fully remote CET ±2h or Barcelona-based.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Mob Control** 
 .
   

  

 With Mob Control, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are about to make a big leap forward to push Mob Control into the next level, and you might be the chosen one, Neo.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in the upcoming evolution of Mob Control, a mobile game with over 400 million downloads.
   

  

 As a Senior Technical Artist, you’ll bridge the gap between art and engineering, designing scalable UI/UX systems, building stylized shaders, and solving creative challenges that directly impact gameplay and player experience.
   

  

 We’re looking for a hybrid profile: someone with strong artistic fundamentals and enough technical experience to bring modular, visually stunning systems to life in Unity. You’ll collaborate closely with game designers, developers, and artists in a fast-paced LiveOps environment, contributing to one of the world’s most played mobile games.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and implement modular and reusable UI/UX systems (cards, popups, banners, upgrades, etc.).
* Create custom shaders and materials (2D/3D) for characters, environments, and UI elements.
* Build tween-based animation systems and shader-based responsive feedback fx.
* Support gameplay teams with technical visual solutions and FX that enhance readability and impact.
* Develop and integrate screen-space FX and postprocessing effects for menus and gameplay.
* Contribute to VFX design for in-game actions, events, and player feedback.
* Prototype and maintain tools to streamline art production and optimize pipelines.
* Create basic 3D models or animations as placeholder content when needed.


 Profile
   

  

* 6+ years of experience in game development, ideally in mobile or stylized GaaS titles.
* Proven track record across full production cycles (from pre-production to LiveOps).
* Strong grasp of visual design principles: color, form, contrast, timing, motion.
* Solid Unity experience: uGUI, Shader Graph or Amplify, Animation and Timeline systems.
* Experience creating stylized shaders for VFX and gameplay.
* Familiarity with editor tools and custom inspectors in Unity.
* Proficiency in 2D/3D tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, Blender, or Maya.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in high-volume LiveOps pipelines with frequent content updates.
* A strong portfolio of stylized UI/UX, VFX, or technical art systems.
* Passion for solving creative problems through smart, scalable technical workflows.


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Insight & Analytics Manager
description:
Svensk Fastighetsförmedling som en del av Korall Group har nu möjligheten att erbjuda dig en strategisk nyckelroll som Insight & Analytics Manager. Rollen är ett vikariat på 12 månader med möjlighet till viss förlängning. I rollen kommer du tillsammans med ditt team att driva affärsnytta genom data, insikter och analys. I rollen kommer du att ha många kontaktytor både intern och externt och som en naturlig del kommer du att få stort utlopp för ditt innovativa och framåtlutade förhållningssätt.
 



  





**OM ROLLEN** 




 Som Insight & Analytics Manager jobbar du nära affären och ledningsgruppen och ansvarar för att:
 


* Leda och utveckla insikts- och analysfunktionen, inklusive budget och kompetensplanering
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla teamets verktyg, metoder och processer
* Driva ett Data-as-a-Service-tänk där organisationen får tillgång till rätt data på ett tillgängligt och användbart sätt
* Vara produktägare för vår BI-plattform (Power BI) och GA4, med ansvar för roadmap, backlogg och affärskrav
* Kommunicera komplexa insikter på ett pedagogiskt och inspirerande sätt till olika delar av organisationen
* Vidareutveckla mätningar inom kundnöjdhet, varumärkestracking och kundsegmentering
* Arbeta med digital analys från webb, appar, sociala medier, e-post och sms
* Delta i affärsutvecklingsprojekt och stötta andra bolag inom koncernen med insikter.



 Verktyg du kommer att arbeta med:
 



 Power BI, SPSS, GA4, Google Tag Manager, Hotjar, KVS (egenutvecklat CRM, Symplify, SurveyMonkey m.fl.
 



  





 I rollen ingår personalansvar för vår fantastiska BI-datascientist och som Insight & Analytics Manager blir du en del av vår Experience avdelning. Du rapporterar till Chief Experience Officer. Önskad start 1 november 2025.
 



  





**VEM VI SÖKER** 




 Vi söker dig som brinner för att utveckla och bidra med insikt till organisationer. Du har en god pedagogisk förmåga och en vana av att presentera data för beslutsfattare, som en naturlig del i arbetet är du självgående med en förmåga att planera och driva ditt eget arbete mot uppsatta mål. Vi tror att du är en person som får energi av att inspirera andra kring hur man kan bli bättre med hjälp av paketerade analyser. Du har en god förmåga att kommunicera med stakeholders och intressenter samt att förklara och förenkla komplexa frågor. Som person är du strukturerad och analytisk och gillar att kombinera eget arbete och samarbete med andra.
 



  





**KRAVPROFIL** 



* En akademisk utbildning inom statistik, dataanalys, matematik eller likvärdigt
* God erfarenhet av ledarskap inom analys, insikt och BI
* Gedigen erfarenhet av digital analys och verktyg som Power BI, GA4 och Tag Manager
* Förmåga att översätta affärsmål till mätbara KPI:er och vidareutveckla strukturer för uppföljning
* Erfarenhet av både kvalitativa och kvantitativa undersökningsmetoder och kunna göra statistiska analyser med hjälp av SPSS.



  





**Vi ser det som meriterande om du har** 



* Branscherfarenhet från mäkleri eller liknande tjänsteförmedlande verksamheter
* Certifieringar inom dataanalys, BI eller datavisualisering
* Erfarenhet av CRM-analys och verktyg som Salesforce eller Symplify
* Kunskap om undersökningsverktyg som SurveyMonkey, Hotjar eller Contentsquare.



 Vi ser gärna att du också arbetet med strategisk förståelse för varumärkes- och kampanjutvärdering och dess påverkan på försäljning.
 



  





**KONTAKT** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att höra av dig till TA Manager Anna Liljegren Rassing
 
 Anna.LiljegrenRassing@Svenskfast.se
 
 . Notera att alla ansökningar sker via annonsen av GDPR-skäl.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan snarast då urvalet kommer att ske löpande.
 



  





**OM OSS** 




 Svensk Fastighetsförmedling är en del av Korall Group. Genom att utgå ifrån kundens situation och drivkrafter när vi utvecklar vår affär och erbjudande, blir vi mer relevanta och vi säkrar den bästa bostadsaffären och en stärkt boenderesa. Svensk Fastighetsförmedling är Sveriges största rikstäckande och oberoende mäklarkedja. Vi är experter på den lokala bostadsmarknaden med verksamhet i både Sverige och Spanien och har fler än 1250 medarbetare. Korall Groups vision är att skapa ett ekosystem av tjänster för boendelivet där värden växer. Korall Group utvecklar och erbjuder nya attraktiva tjänster både innan, under och efter bytet av bostad. Idag ingår även portföljbolaget Ordna Bolån samt intressebolaget HouseID. Tillsammans förenklar, möjliggör och inspirerar vi människor i alla faser av boendelivet.

title: Data Engineer
description:
*Vill du jobba i teknikens framkant och samtidigt skapa affärsvärde genom hög datakvalitet?*  

*Vi söker* ***TRE*** *Data Engineers som vill vara med och driva vårt Datakvalitétsarbete, i nära samarbete med våra produkt- och utvecklingsteam inom våra tre varumärken Norion Bank, Walley och Collector*.  

  

**OM ROLLEN**  

Som Data Engineer ansvarar du för att bygga upp vår nya dataplattform samt att implementera och kontinuerligt förbättra flera centrala dataprodukter. Du arbetar hands-on tillsammans med teamet, bidrar med teknisk expertis och driver vårt Datakvalitétsarbete framåt. En viktig del av rollen är också att samla in krav och samarbeta nära verksamheten för att skapa värdeskapande dataprodukter.

 **OM DIG**  

Vi söker dig som har både teknisk kompetens och ett starkt engagemang för datakvalitet och samarbete. Du är nyfiken, initiativrik och trivs med att arbeta i en miljö där ständig utveckling och lärande uppmuntras.


Du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknik med kommunikation, där ditt bidrag gör verklig skillnad, både i teamet och för verksamheten i stort.


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete med databehandling i en modern dataplattform, gärna Databricks,
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av programmering i Python eller annat relevant skriptspråk,
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat med datakvalitet och data governance,
* Van att arbeta hands-on i tekniska team, samtidigt som du har förståelse för affärsbehov,
* God samarbetsförmåga och erfarenhet av kravinsamling i dialog med verksamheten.
  


Vi ser det som meriterande om du:

* Erfarenhet av att bygga dataprodukter inom en datamesh-arkitektur,
* Tidigare arbete med att driva utbildning eller kunskapsdelning inom dataområdet.
* Intresse för att påverka och förbättra processer kring datahantering och datakvalitet i en växande organisation.
  


Koncernspråket är svenska, och du behöver därför kommunicera flytande på svenska för att lyckas i rollen.

  

På Norion Bank arbetar vi enligt en hybrid-setup med både kontorsarbete och distansarbete. Kontorsarbetet sker på vårt fina huvudkontor vid Lilla Bommen i Göteborg. Där sitter våra team tillsammans vilket främjar både kommunikation och samarbete.


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med en inledande provanställning, med start enligt överenskommelse.

 **OM NORION BANK GROUP**  

Norion Bank Group är en affärsnära nordisk finansieringsbank. Genom koncernens varumärken Norion Bank, Walley och Collector erbjuds kundanpassade finansieringstjänster som möter distinkta kundbehov inom tre kundsegment: medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag, handlare och privatpersoner. Som specialist på finansieringslösningar är Norion Bank Group ett ledande komplement till traditionella storbanker, med visionen att vara den främsta nordiska finansieringsbanken inom de utvalda segmenten.


Norion Banks erbjudande omfattar företags- och fastighetskrediter samt factoring för medelstora företag och fastighetsbolag. Genom varumärket Walley erbjuds flexibla betal- och checkoutlösningar till handlare och privatpersoner. Varumärket Collector tillhandahåller privatlån och kreditkort till privatpersoner samt sparkonton för privatpersoner och företag. Norion Bank Group (tidigare Collector Bank) grundades 1999 och har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Oslo och Helsingfors. Verksamheten bedrivs genom Norion Bank AB (publ) som är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm.  

  

**NORION BANKS ERBJUDANDE TILL DIG**  

För oss är det självklart att varje individs utveckling värdesätts högt vilket innebär ett stort fokus på självledarskap och kompetensutveckling. Gemenskap, innovation och modern arbetsmetodik är saker som kännetecknar Norion Bank Group. Vi erbjuder dig helt enkelt en organisation med snabba beslutsvägar, stor öppenhet och mycket energi.


Våra värdeord Affärsmässighet, Engagemang och Omtanke genomsyrar allt vi gör och som medarbetare hos oss blir du en del av vår starka företagskultur. Vi erbjuder dig ett spännande bolag med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, löpande kompetensutveckling och gemensamma aktiviteter på och utanför arbetsplatsen.

**Vi undanber oss kontakt med rekry****teringsbolag, konsultbolag samt** **annonsörer** **i rekryteringen.**  

  

**INTRESSERAD?**  

Kul! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så ansök redan idag!


Frågor? Välkommen att höra av dig till oss!  

För frågor kring teamet och rollen - kontakta gärna Lars Pettersson, Head of development Business Intelligence and Data Infra på lars.pettersson@norionbank.se


Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Jesper Östlund, HR Business Partner på jesper.ostlund@norionbank.se

**Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!**

title: It-säkerhetsspecialist
description:
**Sista ansökningsdag: 27 augusti 2025**


Specialist


Stockholm


Säkerhetspolisen stärker kontinuerligt verksamheten för it-säkerhet. Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa it-miljöer och vill vara med och bidra till att göra Sverige säkrare? Lockas du av att få arbeta med it-säkerhet på riktigt, tillsammans med några av de vassaste personerna inom området? Välkommen med din ansökan.


Tillsammans skyddar vi Sverige.



Referensnummer: 2025-12842



Det här är ditt uppdrag


I rollen som it-säkerhetsspecialist syftar ditt arbete till att skydda Sverige och myndighetens informationssystem mot säkerhetshotande händelser.


Här får du arbeta med komplexa it-miljöer tillsammans med engagerade och kompetenta kollegor inom informations- och it-säkerhetsområdet. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innefattar arbete med kravställning, granskning, uppföljning och rådgivning inom it-säkerhetsområdet. Som specialist förväntas du kunna hålla ihop och leda utveckling av kravställning, processer och rutiner.


För att vidmakthålla och utveckla din kompetens får du kontinuerlig fortbildning inom ditt område.


Din placering är på huvudkontoret i Solna och arbetet utförs på plats, vilket innebär att du inte har möjlighet att arbeta på distans. Resor inom Sverige kan förekomma.



De här kvalifikationerna söker vi hos dig


Det är endast du som uppfyller nedanstående krav som kan bli aktuell för tjänsten.

* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område alternativt kunskap inhämtad via arbetslivserfarenhet som Säkerhetspolisen bedömer likvärdig
* Flerårig och aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom it-säkerhet genom exempelvis kravställning, granskning eller ackreditering av it-system
* Erfarenhet av arbete i it-miljöer med höga säkerhetskrav
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska i tal och skrift
* God förmåga att kommunicera på engelska i tal och skrift


Anställningen kräver svenskt medborgarskap.


Du som söker kan också ha kompetens som tillför bredd och kompletterande perspektiv. Kan du bidra med något eller flera av följande är det **meriterande**:

* Erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, penetrationstestning eller red team-övningar
* Kunskap om standarder inom informations- och it-säkerhet, såsom ISO 27000, CIS Controls, NIST 800-53
* Kunskap om Nato-regelverk
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsskydd och säkerhetskänslig verksamhet
* Tidigare arbete vid eller mot myndighet
  


Det här är kollegan vi söker


Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som motiveras av komplexa utmaningar. Du har ett genuint intresse för it-säkerhetsfrågor och drivs av ett kvalitetsinriktat arbetssätt. Som person är du lyhörd, har ett öga för detaljer och driver självständigt ditt arbete framåt. Vidare är du noggrann, strukturerad och ansvarsfull.


Då arbetet utförs i nära samarbete med dina kollegor är det av högsta vikt att du har god samarbetsförmåga och uppskattar teamarbete. Du är en naturlig ledare med förmågan att be om, ta emot och erbjuda hjälp när det behövs.


Ditt intresse för it-säkerhetsfrågor gör att du håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer i utvecklingen gällande teknologier, arbetsmetoder och produkter. Eftersom både teknik och arbetsuppgifter varierar över tid behöver du vara flexibel och kunna anpassa dig efter en omvärld som ständigt förändras.


Säkerhetspolisen ställer höga krav på säkerhet och sekretess, därför förutsätter vi att du har ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande.



Anställningsvillkor och förmåner


Säkerhetspolisen prioriterar alla medarbetares goda hälsa och strävar efter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Hos oss utövar du friskvård på arbetstid och vi erbjuder individuell träning och gruppträning i egna träningslokaler på vårt huvudkontor i Solna. Därutöver erbjuds alla medarbetare ett individuellt friskvårdsbidrag som går att utnyttja enligt Skatteverkets gällande regler för friskvårdsbidrag för motions- eller friskvårdsaktiviteter.


Som anställd vid en statlig myndighet har du fler semesterdagar än på många andra arbetsplatser. Till och med det år du fyller 29 har du 28 dagar semester per år. Från och med det år du fyller 30 har du 31 dagar semester och från och med det år du fyller 40 har du 35 dagar semester.


Utöver statlig tjänstepension (PA 16) har Säkerhetspolisen ett lokalt avtal som ger alla anställda en extra månatlig pensionsavsättning, som motsvarar ungefär en halv månadslön per år. Vid föräldraledighet får du en extra föräldralön som innebär omkring 90 procent av din lön. I anställningsavtalet ingår även extra försäkring som ger ekonomiskt skydd för make, maka, registrerad partner, sambo och barn.


Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav, då anställning vid Säkerhetspolisen innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs också godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.


Det här är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.



Så tar du kontakt med oss


Du är välkommen att ringa rekryterande chef, tfn 010-568 76 00. För information om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult, tfn 010-568 91 27.


Fackliga företrädare: Polisförbundet, tfn 010-568 70 03, SACO, tfn 010-568 70 04 och ST, tfn 010-568 70 02.



Så ansöker du



Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, www.sakerhetspolisen.se


Ansökan ska ha kommit in senast **2025-08-27**.


Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (i den här rekryteringsprocessen önskar vi inget personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett. Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på frågorna och inte hänvisar till andra handlingar t.ex. CV.

**Vänligen bifoga ett separat dokument (pdf eller word) med svar på urvalsfrågorna nedan.**

Personuppgifterna du angivit i din ansökan behandlar vi enligt EU:s dataskyddsförordning.

  

Information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering vid Säkerhetspolisen



Ansök här

(Genom att klicka på länken dirigeras du till vårt ansökningsverktyg. Du kommer där att behöva ange en giltig e-postadress dit en länk till ansökan för tjänsten skickas)



Övrig information


Du bör inte berätta att du sökt tjänst hos Säkerhetspolisen för andra personer än dina närmast berörda. Det beror på att vi har tjänster som omfattas av sekretess.


I den här rekryteringen använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester.


Vi har redan gjort våra val av annonskanaler. Vi undanber oss därför samtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.



Publicerad
6 augusti 2025
Så här arbetar vi på Säkerhetspolisen



Säkerhetspolisens uppdrag är att skydda Sverige, det demokratiska systemet samt medborgarnas fri- och rättigheter. Det är vårt ansvar att det som inte får hända, inte heller händer.  

Dina kollegor är specialister, sakkunniga och samhällsintresserade. De vet att saker inte alltid är som de ser ut att vara vid första anblick. Därför söker vi personer som bidrar med kompletterande perspektiv, kunskaper och erfarenheter som sammantaget gör oss bättre.  

Det finns många olika yrken och kompetenser hos oss, och oavsett roll kommer du att samverka med och lära mycket av andra. Du kommer också att arbeta självständigt och utvecklas i din roll. Oavsett arbetsuppgift är du med och bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet.  

Som medarbetare på Säkerhetspolisen kan du förvänta dig ett ledarskap som bygger på helhetssyn, handlingskraft, goda relationer och lärande. Våra ledare coachar, stöttar och utmanar dig att ta ansvar för din och verksamhetens utveckling. Tillsammans bidrar vi alla till att skapa ett tryggt, öppet klimat med avsikt att förstå andras perspektiv och goda intentioner.  


Vill du veta mer?  

Rekryteringsprocessen  

Frågor och svar

title: It-tekniker till Karlstad!
description:
Vi letar efter dig med relevant utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet som kan driva dina egna processer, både självständigt och i team. Du är nyfiken, vill lära dig och utvecklas. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med varierande IT-projekt, alltid med stöd från erfarna kollegor.
  
  

Du erbjuds,
  
En stimulerande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö.
  
Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och varierande projekt.
  
Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
  
Stöd och utbildning för din professionella utveckling.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Har drivkraft att utvecklas
  
Är en lagspelare
  
Har god kommunikation och är serviceinriktad

title: Systemingenjörer IT
description:
Till vår kund i Helsingborg söker vi ett flertal Systemingenjörer enligt följande beskrivnning. Där det finns behov av en (1) konsult som är mer specialiserad inom cybersäkerhet, en (1) inom kravhantering och en (1) inom arkitektur.
  
Uppdraget är säkerhetsklassat och kräver godkänd säkerhetsprövning samt krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
  
--------------
  
Som Systemingenjör hos vår kund har du en viktig roll i att omvandla tekniska koncept till innovativa och hållbara lösningar. Du kommer att tillhöra Solutionsteamet, där vi utvecklar och levererar kompletta IT-lösningar, skräddarsydda efter kundens behov och specifikationer. Vi förverkligar deras IT-vision genom att erbjuda robusta och pålitliga infrastrukturlösningar.
  
I din roll arbetar du i projektgrupper genom hela projektets livscykel, från idé till färdig lösning och i nära samarbete med både interna team och externa kunder. Som systemingenjör är det du som realiserar systemarkitekturen för att säkerställa att alla systemkomponenter fungerar i komplexa systemstrukturer och krävande miljöer.
  
Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
  
* Utforma och utveckla systemarkitektur på flera nivåer för att säkerställa skalbara och robusta lösningar, med fokus på IT-hårdvara
* Rekommendera och implementera tekniska lösningar för både interna och externa kunder
* Utarbeta projektmodeller, styrande dokument, systembeskrivningar och annan viktig dokumentation som stödjer utvecklingsarbetet
* Fånga upp och dokumentera krav, samt etablera och hantera kravbaser.
* Arbeta brett med varierande uppgifter, från kravanalys och teknisk specifikation till kunddialog och dokumentationsgranskning
* Stödja interna team i utvecklingen av både hårdvara och mjukvara för att säkerställa att systemen lever upp till krav och förväntningar
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla företagets ramverk för Systems Engineering och bidra till en kultur av kontinuerlig innovation


Det här bidrar du med
  
* Erfarenhet som systemingenjör med kunskap inom kravhantering och systemlivscykelprocesser (exempelvis enligt INCOSE, ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288)
* Utbildning inom datavetenskap, teknikutbildning, mekatronik, elektronikingenjör eller systemutveckling med fokus på hårdvara. Alternativt motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet, exempelvis driftsättning av maskiner eller IT-infrastruktur/nätverk
* Erfarenhet av kundkontakt samt vana att arbeta i projekt och projektteam
* Du är en lagspelare som är nyfiken, drivande och affärsorienterad med fokus på innovation
* Kunskap inom nätverk och IT är meriterande
* Kunskap inom cybersäkerhet är meriterande
* Vana vid modellering eller scriptning (t.ex. Python eller PowerShell) ses som ett plus
* God kommunikativ förmåga i både svenska och engelska

title: Vi behöver juniora IT-supportekniker! Titta hit!
description:
Gillar du IT och har förmågan att läsa mellan raderna och ställa riktade följdfrågor? Kanon, då måste du läsa vidare.
  
En trevlig helpdesk med fokus på firstline ärenden i Malmö söker nu dig som kollega. Vardagen speglas av hjälpsamhet, och teamwork, detta i en kombo av tempoväxlingar. För att lyckas behöver du vara kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och driven. Självklart är det också viktigt att du har ett genuint intresse för IT och teknik. Vi letar efter dig som brinner för IT och service. Du har troligtvis en IT-utbildning i grunden. Det är ett plus i kanten om du har erfarenhet av 1st line support sedan tidigare. Vi ser gärna att du har kännedom om exempelvis Active Directory, Windows 7/10, Basic Nätverk (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP), Felsökning, Ärendehantering samt Mobila enheter. Det är viktigt att du är lyhörd och värdesätter goda kundkontakter. Det är även avgörande för rollen att du är analytisk, noggrann och kan arbeta strukturerat.
  
Varje dag hanterar du ärende från kunder via telefon, chatt samt e-post. Det är ett växlande tempo där vardagen styrs av händelser i kundens miljö, trots detta håller ni alltid en hög kvalitet och servicenivå. Krav - Svenska och engelska flytande! - Kunskaper i Active Directory, Windows Server, basic nätverk, felsökning Meriterande om - Du har arbetat i servicedesk sedan tidigare - Har ett härligt driv och är prestigelös och flexibel - Har en vidareutbildning exempelvis från YH eller Universitet Joina oss!

title: Data Engineer – Join the backbone of Sweden’s financial market @ Euroclear
company: ANTS Akademiskt Nätverk av Tekniska Studenter AB
description:
At Euroclear Sverige, we are building the data backbone of the financial market – and we want you to be part of it. As part of the global Euroclear group, we enable secure and efficient trading for banks, institutions, and listed companies.
  
We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our Issuer Product team and help modernize Sweden’s financial infrastructure. In this role, you’ll design and build robust databases and data workflows for client-facing applications that power the stock market. You’ll work hands-on with SQL Server, ETL pipelines, and cloud solutions in a collaborative, cross-functional team where your expertise will make a real impact. Why join us? At Euroclear Sweden, you’ll be part of a family-like culture in a supportive, agile team where collaboration and openness drive progress, and every contribution is valued. Your skills will play a key role in strengthening the systems behind Sweden’s financial data flows, supporting transactions for major financial institutions and listed companies. We also care about your well-being and professional growth, offering 30 vacation days, a healthcare allowance, food benefits, a pension plan, bonus scheme, and parental leave top-up. What you will do You’ll join a dynamic and diverse workforce and share knowledge generously. As your future manager, Stefan (Technical Product Owner) will often ask: “Do you have fun at work?” – because we believe great results come from enjoying what we do. In this role, you will:
  
* Design, implement, and maintain relational and non-relational databases, both on-premise and in the cloud. • Develop and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, triggers, and ETL workflows. • Monitor performance, tune databases, and ensure data security, integrity, and availability. • Troubleshoot issues and support seamless integration with applications. • Collaborate with developers, analysts, and architects on data solutions. • Document database structures and workflows, and use version control (Git) and basic scripting (e.g., Python).


About you You are analytical, hands-on, and thrive working close to the data layer. With strong collaboration skills, you bring:
  
3–5 years of experience in database development and ETL workflows
  
Strong skills in SQL Server, query optimization, and data-driven workflows
  
Familiarity with cloud-based solutions and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB)
  
Experience with system analysis, debugging, and performance tuning
  
Ability to work in cross-functional teams and produce clear technical documentation
  
  

About Euroclear Sweden Euroclear Sweden plays a central role in Sweden’s financial market as part of the global Euroclear group. We provide innovative solutions for securities management and clearing services, enabling businesses to efficiently handle and register transactions involving Swedish stocks and fixed-income securities. Apply today! We’re currently on summer break but will be back on August 12 to review applications. Questions? Contact: Sanela Filipovic, Talent Acquisition Partner (sanela.filipovic@ants.se)

title: Application Integration Specialist
description:
At Benifex, we’re on a mission to revolutionize employee benefits and engagement. Born from the merger of Benify and Benefex, we’ve combined forces to build remarkable experiences that employees love. With 1,200+ Benifexers across 14 global offices, we partner with 3,000 customers in 120+ countries, supporting 5 million users worldwide . Ready to be part of an exciting journey ahead? Welcome to Benifex!
  
  

Are you passionate about building seamless technical solutions and ensuring smooth data flows? Join Benifex as an Application Integration Specialist, where you’ll help connect systems, applications, and processes across our international organization. As an Application Integration Specialist, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of integrations between various software systems. Your work ensures data consistency, accuracy, and reliability, and directly contributes to the successful launch and maintenance of our client solutions.
  
This position requires a strong technical foundation, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You’ll be part of a team of Application Integration Specialists based in both Sweden and Lithuania, working cross-functionally within a squad that operates in sprints. In this role you will:
  
Configure, customize, and develop integrations using the Benifex platform, APIs, web services, and tools like Node-RED.
  
Scope, implement, and troubleshoot data transfers between systems.
  
Test integrations to ensure functionality and quality.
  
Collaborate with internal teams and third-party vendors to ensure successful deployments.
  
Maintain and improve integration solutions.
  
  

Personal attributes You enjoy working across teams and get energy from translating technical needs into scalable integration solutions. We’re looking for someone who thrives in a role with multiple points of contact, working closely with stakeholders across teams, both locally and internationally.
  
We also see that you have
  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  
Fundamental understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (e.g., Java, C++, .NET).
  
Proficiency in integration technologies, APIs, web services, and messaging protocols (e.g., SOAP, REST).
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  
Professional proficiency in English, both spoken and written.
  
  

It's a , thus not a requirement if you also got...
  
Hands-on experience with Node-RED or similar integration tools.
  
Knowledge of Single Sign-On (SSO) protocols and standards, and the ability to integrate applications with SSO solutions.
  
Knowledge of project management methodologies and the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple integration projects simultaneously.
  
  

Perks of being a Benifexer
  
Collective agreement
  
Wellness allowance of 4000 SEK
  
30 vacation days
  
ITP1 pension
  
Lifeplan - a leading financial advisory service that offers personalized advice for maximizing your pension savings
  
A variety of social events and activities at our offices
  
Hybrid working - minimum 3 days/week from the office.
  
  

As a Benifexer, you'll enjoy a forward-thinking culture that encourages personal and professional growth. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that values creativity and new ideas, with a commitment to diversity and inclusion. With a nearly gender-balanced team, we prioritize creating a supportive workplace where everyone can thrive.
  
**Practical information Start:** August/September Extent: Full-time, 100% Location: Gothenburg or Stockholm
  
Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.
  
Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.

title: Senior Cloud Data Engineer - Clickstream
description:
About Us


At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.



FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
  

  

We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.



Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?


At FDJ United, data and analytics are crucial to our growth and innovation as we expand into new markets. We are seeking a Senior Cloud Data Engineer with extensive experience in clickstream data to join our Analytics Tech team. In this role, you will manage our clickstream data architecture on AWS, ensuring the generation of high-quality datasets that accurately reflect customer behaviour across various digital platforms.



You will work with cutting-edge technologies, including Snowplow for event tracking, Amazon Redshift for data warehousing, dbt cloud for data transformations, and Open Metadata for data governance. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you'll help define and implement next-generation data architectures that drive actionable insights and enhance operational efficiency. If you're passionate about leveraging data to understand customer behaviour, we invite you to take the next step in your career with us at FDJ United.



Responsibilities:



* Equip analysts and other teams with efficient models for decision making, marketing, product reporting, analysis analysis.
* Drive automation initiatives by building schemas that facilitate automated data processing workflows, aligning with the long-term vision for Redshift
* Drive the adoption of dbt as a service by providing training, support, and documentation, while ensuring data models are scalable and efficient.
* Develop and deploy a semantic layer to connect dbt models with natural language querying tools, enhancing data access and analysis for business users.
* Optimize time-to-insight through effective use of dbt and optimization of Redshift data structures.
* Share expertise in data collection and transformation practices to promote awareness of tracking and dbt across the organization.
* Support proof-of-concept generative AI initiatives to explore opportunities for operational efficiencies and business growth.
* Stay updated on advancements in data collection, transformation, cloud, and AI technologies, bringing innovative ideas to data engineering practices.
What will you need?



* Strong understanding of clickstream data and data collection.
* Strong background in data modelling, particularly in clickstream data modelling.
* Extensive experience with data build tools such as dbt, and advanced data modelling skills.
* Understanding of AWS DevOps practices
* Experience in implementing governance frameworks.
* Experience with data catalogues to document processes and data models for maintainability and knowledge transfer.
* Excellent proficiency in SQL, Python, or any other programming language (advantageous).
* Experience in introducing technical efficiencies as code optimisation and process improvements, such as ways of working.
* Ability to manage ambiguity, exhibiting a willingness to learn through iterative processes and demonstrating a proactive attitude.
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, translating business requirements into technical specifications for data models.
* Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering large analytical projects while effectively managing stakeholders.
Preferred Qualifications



In addition, it would be advantangeous to have:



* AWS certification.
* dbt certification.
* Experience as a digital analytics implementation developer.
* Knowledge of Python.
At Kindred we see challenges as an opportunity to do something in a better way both personally and professionally. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to the society. Our ambition is to reach 0% revenue from harmful gambling by 2023. Our success is built on trust; we trust each other to deliver on our promises and believe giving ownership and responsibility at all levels is the way to make the right choices for Kindred and our customers.



What do we offer?



* A great team with passionate analysts and engineers


 Mix of 60+ nationalities and Swedish culture in an English-speaking environment  

 Awesome offices with ergonomic desks, pool and table tennis tables, VR area, gym and yoga area, subsidised lunch, free breakfast, daily fresh fruit  

 25 days paid vacation plus bank holidays  

 3 days CSR leave  

 Bonus plan

 Training budget


* ️ Private medical insurance and free eye test



 Enhanced maternity, paternity, and shared parental leave



 £300 Wellbeing allowance  

 Up to 8% matched pension contributions  

 Flexible working



 Occasional travel to other FDJ United Group offices including Stockholm and Malta



* Meetups and calendar of social events in the office; quarterly Analytics socials.



Our Way Of Working


Our world is hybrid.



A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.


Application Process


We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

  

Details


**Hybrid**

**Stockholm**

**TEC2565**

Location

Regeringsgatan 25, Stockholm, Sweden, 111 53**Loading...**


Benefits

### **Maxim Martea**

title: IT Solution Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will do**
--------------------


At **MSP PTP Production** you will contribute to the transformation of our company, the transport industry and society at large. You will:

  

As a **IT Solution Engineer,** you will interface with customers and identify their needs. You will be responsible for delivering the solution that supports the business requirements, using various technologies (COTS or other), products and platforms. You will interact with various team-members to provide the right solutions, expertise, guidance and learning. You will balance various aspects of the delivery, from end to end, including development. Additionally, you research advanced technology regarding best practices in the field and seek to find cost-effective solutions. Also you are going to be the Tech Lead driving North Star Review process, maintaing Life Cycle Management and propose improvement of the current solutions.

  

Additionally that is also expected from you:

* Lead in delivering the identified solution
* Provide detailed functional and non-funtional requirements and specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved.
* Work closely with Product teams to ensure products and solutions are available and working properly.
* Ensure that the solution developed complies with given architecture guidelines, specifications and business partner quality requirements and ensuring the usage of standards, tools and platforms
* Identify and propose solutions and features to fit product
* Solve assigned issues together with the business
* Analyze current technologies used and perform techwatch, build prototypes and PoCs.
* Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates requirements such as legal, customer experience or other.

 **Your future team**


The Köping Digital Factory team consists of Software Engineers, Digital Product Owner, Solution Architect and Scrum Master working towards digitalization of the Köping Factory while maintain and decom legacy solutions.

**Who are you?**
----------------


Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, you will bring:

  

* Deep experience with IT Solutions Development within .NET and MFSA (Manufacturing Service architecture) area.
* Good knowledge with SCADA (PLC)
* At least 10 years of IT solution development background
* Good knowledge on data strategy
* Good knowledge on cyber security
* Good knowledge on modern achitecture
* Advanced English language skills. Swedish is a plus.
* Be able to **work on site Köping**
**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package — but what truly sets us apart is the experience you'll gain as part of our team.

  

You’ll step into a dynamic environment where digital transformation is driving exciting opportunities to explore and implement new technologies. You’ll work alongside a team that’s genuinely committed to improving how we work, constantly seeking smarter, more efficient ways to move forward. Collaboration is at the core of our culture, with dedicated stakeholders from a Volvo plant who share your drive to deliver the very best. And with the strength of the Volvo Group behind you, your career can grow in directions you never imagined.

**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!

 **Last application date:** 31st of August


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
Are you a network professional looking for a new challenge? I'm Zahed Iqbal, and I'm searching for a curious individual like you, ready to leave a lasting mark. Join our team, where your skills will thrive, and together - let's make better happen!


Data Center Networks Team is responsible for the development, operations, maintenance, life cycle management and capacity planning of Datacenter network infrastructures. The team is in Infrastructure and Data unit which is developing, maintaining, and operating our Datacenters' IT infrastructure and internal platforms (private cloud, integration). It plays a key role in delivering production quality and customer experience for continued growth in Telia Company.  



  

**As a Senior Network Engineer…**

You will be responsible for overseeing the technical design, architecture, development, maintenance, and operation of cloud-ready data center networks. You’ll work closely with engineering and development teams within the Infrastructure and Data unit to build common cloud and compute infrastructure. You will utilize automation frameworks and tools for network programming, as well as collaborating with developers and IT teams to integrate and automate network infrastructure and services.


You will ensure seamless integration of both public and private cloud infrastructure with data center networks and maintain a highly available, scalable, and reliable network while monitoring performance, forecasting capacity needs, and managing the network lifecycle. Additionally, you will evaluate and recommend new technologies and tools to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the network and cloud infrastructure.


**Who we're looking for...**

Someone proficient in network operating systems, including Cisco ACI, IOS, IOS XR, and NXOS, and demonstrated experience working in complex, large-scale data center environments. Strong expertise in routing, switching, and network security is essential.


Experience with Cisco switches and routers, including software and hardware upgrades, patching, and troubleshooting. Proven ability to deliver both high-level and low-level network design, particularly within data center environments, is also needed.


The position also requires familiarity with network programming and automation tools, such as Python, Terraform. Knowledge of one or more cloud platforms (such as AWS, Azure, GCP).


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


*(Monthly salary range for this position: 4200 - 6400 EUR before tax deduction. This range is applicable for candidates based in Lithuania).*

**Ready to make better happen?**

We are looking forward to your application by 2025-08-19. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.  



  

If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at zahed.iqbal@teliacompany.com or on LinkedIn .


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**
